title.value: A Systematic Study of Joint Representation Learning on Protein Sequences and Structures
title.justification: This is the title of the paper as given in the provided text.
title.quote: A Systematic Study of Joint Representation Learning on Protein Sequences and Structures

extractions.description: This paper explores joint protein representation learning by integrating a state-of-the-art Protein Language Model (ESM-2) with various structure encoders (GVP, GearNet, CDConv). It introduces fusion strategies and different pre-training techniques to improve protein function prediction tasks.

type.justification: The paper conducts experiments to evaluate the integration of PLMs and structure encoders, introduces new methods, and reports results based on empirical data.
type.quote: Our method achieves significant improvements over existing sequence- and structure-based methods, setting new state-of-the-art for function annotation.

name.justification: The paper focuses on protein representation learning, which is a core topic within computational biology.
name.quote: Learning effective protein representations is critical in a variety of tasks in biology such as predicting protein functions.

name.justification: The goal of the paper is to enhance protein function prediction using joint representation learning.
name.quote: This study underscores several important design choices for fusing protein sequence and structure information. Our method achieves significant improvements over existing sequence- and structure-based methods, setting new state-of-the-art for function annotation.

name.justification: The paper involves learning from protein structures and integrating structure-based encoders.
name.quote: In contrast, structure-based methods leverage 3D structural information with graph neural networks and geometric pre-training methods show potential in function prediction tasks.

name.justification: The paper utilizes graph neural networks for structure-based protein representation learning.
name.quote: In contrast, structure-based methods leverage 3D structural information with graph neural networks and geometric pre-training methods show potential in function prediction tasks.

name.justification: ESM-2 is frequently mentioned in the paper as a state-of-the-art protein language model used in the study.
name.quote: Our study undertakes a comprehensive exploration of joint protein representation learning by integrating a state-of-the-art PLM (ESM-2) with distinct structure encoders (GVP, GearNet, CDConv).

is_contributed.justification: ESM-2 is a pre-existing model referenced in the study.
is_contributed.quote: These protein language models (PLMs)... notable instances include... ESM (Rives et al. 2021; Lin et al. 2023).

is_executed.justification: The model was implemented and tested in the context of this study.
is_executed.quote: We employ the fusion of three structure encoders with ESM-2-650M using three distinct fusion strategies.

is_compared.justification: The performance of ESM-2 is compared with other models.
is_compared.quote: we observe that while the raw performance of vanilla GearNet lags behind other encoders like CDConv, its integration with PLMs yields better outcomes

referenced_paper_title.value: Biological structure and function emerge from scaling unsupervised learning to 250 million protein sequences
referenced_paper_title.justification: The title of the referenced paper from which ESM-2 is derived.
referenced_paper_title.quote: These protein language models (PLMs)... notable instances include... ESM (Rives et al. 2021; Lin et al. 2023).

name.justification: GearNet is one of the structure encoders used in the study.
name.quote: our study undertakes a comprehensive exploration of joint protein representation learning by integrating a state-of-the-art PLM (ESM-2) with distinct structure encoders (GVP, GearNet, CDConv).

is_contributed.justification: GearNet is a pre-existing model referenced in the study.
is_contributed.quote: Typical examples include GearNet (Zhang et al. 2022b), GVP (Jing et al. 2021), CDConv (Fan et al. 2023).

is_executed.justification: The model was implemented and tested in the context of this study.
is_executed.quote: We employ the fusion of three structure encoders with ESM-2-650M using three distinct fusion strategies.

is_compared.justification: The performance of GearNet is compared with other models.
is_compared.quote: we observe that while the raw performance of vanilla GearNet lags behind other encoders like CDConv, its integration with PLMs yields better outcomes

referenced_paper_title.value: Continuous-Discrete Convolution for Geometry-Sequence Modeling in Proteins
referenced_paper_title.justification: The title of the referenced paper from which CDConv is derived.

name.justification: The AlphaFold Database is used for pre-training in the study.
name.quote: We further explore six diverse pre-training techniques, employing the optimal model from the aforementioned choices and leveraging pre-training on the AlphaFold Database.

referenced_paper_title.value: AlphaFold Protein Structure Database: massively expanding the structural coverage of protein-sequence space with high-accuracy models
referenced_paper_title.justification: The AlphaFold Database is referenced for pre-training in this study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We perform 50 epochs of pre-training on the AlphaFold Database, following the hyperparameters in (Zhang et al. 2022b).

name.justification: The paper mentions that the models are implemented using TorchDrug.
name.quote: These models are implemented using the TorchDrug library (Zhu et al. 2022) and trained across 4 A100 GPUs.

referenced_paper_title.value: TorchDrug: A Powerful and Flexible Machine Learning Platform for Drug Discovery
referenced_paper_title.justification: TorchDrug is referenced as the implementing library in the study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: These models are implemented using the TorchDrug library (Zhu et al. 2022) and trained across 4 A100 GPUs.
